100673.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"au6pi","text":"Top up water to 500 mL. (no need to pH this one!)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"etm8r","text":"Add a stir bar and dissolve all the powder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3euvf","text":"Add milliQ water to about the 400 mL line.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kegl","text":"Add the appropriate amount of Sucrose calculated above and place it in a clean bottle or beaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Sucrose: 0.75 M ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4jjfq","text":"Wear gloves and sterilize work area","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"6E2EFB8BD2FA4F6C88E51351CA8E0A33"}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41A94BE4341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"1M Tris-HCl (pH 8.0)","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"15568025","stats":{"total_protocols":11},"url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/15568025","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Thermo Fisher Scientific"}}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"36CA940C2BF8442093438FF5AAEF863D","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"UltraPure™ 0.5M EDTA, pH 8.0","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"15575020","stats":{"total_protocols":1},"url":"http://","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.lifetechnologies.com","name":"Thermo Scientific"}}},"3":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41A403FD341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"sucrose","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"BP220-1","stats":{"total_protocols":3},"url":"http://www.fishersci.ca/shop/products/d-sucrose-molecular-biology-fisher-bioreagents-3/p-28727#?keyword=sucrose","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Fisher Scientific"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4lu2","text":"Calculation of Tris or EDTA:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blr7v","text":"Use the equation C1V1 = C2V2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b68if","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nul2","text":"Eg for EDTA:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b74qa","text":"(0.5M)(X mL) = (0.04M)(500 mL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56dqt","text":"Solve for X","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a09tr","text":"((0.04M)(500 mL)/(0.5M)) = 40 mL of 0.5M EDTA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

100674.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9esao","text":"Line counter with lab diapers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63dpr","text":"For extra cleanliness, you can place an autoclave or otherwise plastic bin on one side of the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9f2f0","text":"Place the waste flask or container on the other side of the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"440d7","text":"Then place a full sample bottle in the autoclave bin; however, do not remove the cap of the bottle yet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pnbu","text":"Pass the tubing through the peristaltic pump so that the luer end of the tubing is in the waste collection container. The luer end may need to be held in place by draping it through a clamp but do not pinch the tube with clamp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5l8gr","text":"Using tweezers, remove the cotton from a sterile 25 ml pipette, and attach the pipette to the other end of the tubing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9rh6","text":"To begin filtering seawater, invert bottle several times to mix sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ufm","text":"Open the bottle and insert the pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rppv","text":"Turn on the pump and set the flow speed to 1, if use old Cole-Parmer peristaltic pump, or 40-50 if using newer Cole-Parmer peristaltic pumps. Watch to ensure that water is being pumped in the proper direction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2teus","text":"If your filtration station in the direct sunlight, it is recommended to cover or drape the sample bottles with a dark bag while filtering. Alternatively, it is also possible to tape a dark garbage bag up on window to prevent direct sun exposure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ksmm","text":"Rinse the tubing: Allow ~100 ml of water to pass through the entire tubing. If you fill a 2 L polycarbonate bottle, and can just rinse down to the 2 L mark and then turn off the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79qqn","text":"Attach filters: Turn off the pump. Attach a Sterivex filter to the male luer fitting at the end of the tubing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0c1r","text":"Turn back on pump and continue filtering until no water is left in the bottles. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aderv","text":"If the filter(s) clogs prior to complete sample filtration, stop pump and change necessary filter, labeling the first filter as “Filter A” and recording the filtered 3 volume and storing as described below, before attaching a new filter and resuming filtration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4d5td","text":"To store the sterivex filters, first expel any remaining water with a 30-60 ml syringe. Alternatively, you can shake the sterivex filter, forcing excess water out of the inlet (this is what colleen tends to do…wastes less plastic).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fc4gj","text":"Seal the bottom of the Sterivex filter with Parafilm. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"726lf","text":"Using a new pipette tip each time you add anything to the sterivex, add 1.8ml (2 shots of 900 μl) sucrose lysis buffer (SLB) to the Sterivex filter, keeping ~ 200 μl of space in the filter for later addition of reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dho8b","text":"Be sure to switch the pipet tip between each addition of 900 μl of SLB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kequ","text":"Then, seal the top of the Sterivex filter with a small piece of Parafilm or luer lock cap, and label the filters with the date and sample identification [alternatively, you can label the filters before beginning filtration to avoid getting them mixed up if filtering more sample at a time]. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv5nc","text":"Be sure to record the amount of sample filtered on the filter and/or in a field notebook. Depending on equipment available, freeze on dry ice, in liquid nitrogen or at -80°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3hbcd","text":"Store -80°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6h8jg","text":"Do not disassemble tube filter units before cleaning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5q4hr","text":"Insert the 25 ml pipette into a flask containing 2% HCl, and switch on the pump. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c2ds","text":"We tend to rinse 4 sample tubing units at one time with about 1-2 L of 2% HCL total (so each tubing unit gets about 250-500 mL of acid washed through it).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"l8l7","text":"After the HCl wash, rinse the each tubing with 500 mL or more [autoclaved] MilliQ water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9gdi","text":"Excess water can be removed by whipping around tubing (best done outside). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkgj0","text":"Allow tubing set-up to dry before re-autoclaving.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"en2b3","text":"Sample collection bottles should be similarly rinsed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dl40","text":"Add ~100 mL 2% HCl to sample bottle, shake well, pour off HCl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kf34","text":"HCl can be used 3x before disposal, so save what you pour off for another round of bottle washing at a subsequent date (or transfer from bottle to bottle and use the same HCl to rinse 3 bottles). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b6oe","text":"Add ~100-200 mL of autoclaved MilliQ water, or otherwise sterile water, and shake shake shake. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d9qs","text":"Pour off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c5jn","text":"Repeat water rinse one more time to make sure all acid is removed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g6g5","text":"Leave bottles uncapped on counter and allow to dry completely before closing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"236ul","text":"This drying process will take \u003e1 day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5nr7g","text":"This protocol is used to extract genomic DNA from 0.22μl sterivex filters using Phenol-Chlorophorm. As part of the Hakai Institute Ocean Observing Program, biomolecular samples have been collected weekly, from 0 m to near bottom (260 m), to genetically characterize plankton communities in the Northern Salish Sea since 2015. This protocol is developed to work across all domains of life, from viruses to prokaryotes to eukaryotes, allowing for both amplicon sequencing and shotgun sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":100}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

This protocol is used to extract genomic DNA from 0.22μl sterivex filters using Phenol-Chlorophorm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eb1rc","text":"
Spatial coverage and environments of relevance
As part of the Hakai Institute Ocean Observing Program, biomolecular samples have been collected weekly, from 0 to near bottom (260 m), to genetically characterize plankton communities in the Northern Salish Sea since 2015, developing a climatology from which we can begin uncover the physical, chemical and biological drivers of community and functional change in the dynamic coastal waters of coastal British Columbia. This protocol is developed to work across all domains of life, from viruses to prokaryotes to eukaryotes, allowing for both amplicon sequencing and shotgun sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11ndg","text":"
Personnel Required

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"l6fg","text":"Add 100 µL lysozyme (125 mg fully dissolved in 1000 μl 1 x TE) and 20µL RNase A (10 µg/ml: 1µL in 999µL 1 x TE) to each filter.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"351c0","text":"Reseal the top with Parafilm or a luer cap.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ujtm","text":"Incubate Sterivex in a rotating incubator at 37°C for 1h (in labeled 50 ml falcon tubes).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jkb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bf2qk","text":"Add 100 µL Proteinase K and 100 µL (20%) SDS to each filter. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp5fp","text":"Reseal using Parafilm or a luer cap.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mujo","text":"Incubate at 55°C for 1-2 hours in a rotating incubator (in 50ml falcon tubes; be sure to keep the same falcon tube for the same sterivex throughout these incubation steps).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8khc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63sqo","text":"Remove lysate from sterivex filter using a 10cc syringe into a labeled 15 ml falcon tube, use a new syringe for each sample. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99q0d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"auosk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgbud","text":"Repeat as needed until (nearly) all liquid and foam are out of Sterivex. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kb0q","text":"Add 1mL sucrose lysis buffer (SLB), rotate Sterivex with your hands several times to rinse the filter out, and then plunge out the liquid as described above. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"123bb","text":"Pool this with the lysate in the 15 ml tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":18,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":232,"offset":29,"style":"italic"}],"key":"fsb7f","text":"Do not pull up on the plunger while sterivex is attached. You will likely need to do multiple plunges to empty the Sterivex, so unscrew the syringe from the filter, pull back the plunger, reattach to Sterivex, and push and hold to plunge liquid out of Sterivex. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"640A79ABE91948C99E19A9932102DB5E"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2ajk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5u2e","text":"In the fume hood, add an equal volume (about 3mL) of Phenol:Chloroform:IAA (25:24:1), pH 8.0 to the lysate tube. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdmkr","text":"Invert for 10 secondsby hand to mix.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ejq","text":"Spin at 2500 g for 6 min or until the aqueous layer is clear. Wait at least 10 minutes before opening the centrifuge. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32rv4","text":"Transfer the aqueous (top) layer into a new 15 ml falcon tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"djne8","text":"Add an equal volume (approx 3mL) of Chloroform:IAA (24:1) to the tube containing the aqueous layer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lgdp","text":"Invert for 10 seconds by hand. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"so5","text":"Spin at 2500 g for 6 min or until the aqueous layer is clear with no debris. Wait at least 10 minutes before opening the centrifuge. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b0m9","text":"Transfer the aqueous layer into a labeled Amicon Ultra centrifuge tube (UFC801096, EMD Millipore).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9edbf","text":"Top up Amicon with 1-2mL of 1 x TE buffer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m5sl","text":"Spin at 3500 g for 10-15 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c8ju","text":"Check to make sure there is less than 1ml liquid left in Amicon at the end of this (if not, fill up with 2mL 1 x TE and spin again).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e27lq","text":"Add 2 mL TE buffer to Amicon and spin at 3500 g for 6 min. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bqgm","text":"Remove filtrate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7d3pf","text":"Repeat Step 8 twice more (total of 3 washes with 2mL TE). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9jhv","text":"For the last wash, spin until 200 – 500 μl remain in Amicon (typically 8-10 minutes). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36c88","text":"Note the final volume and transfer to a labeled 1.5 μl Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfmdc","text":"Rinse Amicon sides with 50 µL of 1xTE and pool with the rest of the sample in a labeled 1.5mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dd9do","text":"If desired, aliquot 50 µL from the final sample volume into a 1.5ml Eppendorf tube to use as working stock and place in a -20°C freezer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50m2o","text":"Place the remaining DNA stock in the -80°C freezer for long-term storage.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5891m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Use 2 µL of stock DNA when quantifying.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bes2v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
